item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection ‘Games Introduction’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/yu-gi-oh-early-days-collection-games-introduction-trailer

  • PC
  • Switch

A look at the 14 games included in the collection.

Konami has released a new trailer for Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection introducing the 14 games included in the collection.

As previously announced, the games included in the collection are as follows:

  1. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters (1998 / Game Boy)
  2. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters II: Dark Duel Stories (1999 / Game Boy, Game Boy Color)
  3. Yu-Gi-Oh! Monster Capsule (2000 / Game Boy Color) (New)
  4. Yu-Gi-Oh! Dark Duel Stories (2000 Japan, 2002 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Color)
  5. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters 4: Battle of Great Duelists (2000 / Game Boy Color / Includes Online Battles Support)
  6. Yu-Gi-Oh! Dungeon Dice Monsters (2001 Japan, 2003 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Advance) (New)
  7. Yu-Gi-Oh! The Eternal Duelist Soul (2001 Japan, 2002 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  8. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters 6, Expert 2 (2001 / Game Boy Advance)
  9. Yu-Gi-Oh! The Sacred Cards (2002 Japan, 2003 United States, 2004 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  10. Yu-Gi-Oh! Reshef of Destruction (2003 Japan, 2004 United States and Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  11. Yu-Gi-Oh! Worldwide Edition: Stairway to the Destined Duel (2003 / Game Boy Advance) (New)
  12. Yu-Gi-Oh! World Championship Tournament 2004 (2004 / Game Boy Advance)
  13. Yu-Gi-Oh! Destiny Board Traveler (2004 Japan and United States, 2005 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  14. Yu-Gi-Oh! 7 Trials to Glory: World Championship Tournament 2005 (2004 Japan, 2005 United States and Europe / Game Boy Advance)

Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection is due out for Switch and PC via Steam on February 27 worldwide. Read more about the collection here.
Watch the trailer below.

Games Introduction Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves open beta test set for February 20 to 24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/fatal-fury-city-of-the-wolves-open-beta-test-set-for-february-20-to-24

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Play as eight characters across three online modes.

SNK will host a Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves open beta test from February 20 to 24, the company announced. It will be available across PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, and will not require a PlayStation Plus or Game Pass Core subscription.

Get the details below.

From February 20, 2025 at 12:00 a.m. PT / 3:00 a.m. ET through February 24, 2025 at 11:59 p.m. PT / February 25 at 2:59 a.m. ET, PC and console players can choose from eight total characters and throw down with friends in three online modes: Ranked Match, Casual Match, or Room Match. Those eager to hone their skills and learn dynamic combo routes can practice in the offline Training mode.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves introduces a stunning, comic-inspired art style that’s a visual treat for series fans, combined with fights fueled by the cutting-edge REV System to deliver dynamic matches. The open beta offers the public their first opportunity to experience the modernized action of Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves at home, featuring two distinct control schemes tailored to engage both newcomers and seasoned pros.

The Fatal Fury series debuted in 1991, igniting the fighting game boom of the 1990s that took the industry by storm. Garou: Mark of the Wolves, released in 1999, has been the most recent installment in the franchise until now. With fan favorites and new characters making an appearance, Fatal Fury returns with a classic battle system evolved for the next generation of fighters.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on April 24.

item.title: SNES – Nintendo Switch Online adds Fatal Fury 2, Super Ninja Boy, and Sutte Hakkun
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/snes-nintendo-switch-online-adds-fatal-fury-2-super-ninja-boy-and-sutte-hakkun

  • Switch

Three new titles join the lineup.

Fatal Fury 2, Big Run, Super Ninja Boy, and Sutte Hakkun are now available as part of the Super Nintendo Entertainment System – Nintendo Switch Online lineup, Nintendo announced.

Watch a new trailer below.

NES – January 2025 Game Updates

English

Japanese

item.title: Low-poly ‘teeny tiny adventure’ game Merchant 64 announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/low-poly-teeny-tiny-adventure-game-merchant-64-announced-for-pc

SuitNtie has announced Merchant 64, a low-poly 3D “teeny tiny adventure” game inspired by games from the Nintendo 64 era. It will launch for PC via Steam in March.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Merchant 64 a low-poly tiny retro-inspired traveling merchant game! Take control of Merchant as you buy goods at low prices and sell them in different towns at higher prices.

Key Features

  • A Cozy Tiny Adventure – This is a very small game that is designed to be a wonderful short adventure with multiple endings.
  • Make the Big Bucks – In this adventure take control of Merchant as you buy goods at low prices and sell them in different towns at higher prices.
  • Traverse Across Towns – As a traveling merchant you will need you will need explore the world and travel to new towns where you can sell your goods.
  • Purchase Upgrades – Through your adventure, purchase various upgrades to help out on your merchant journey!

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer
